title: Best Golf Courses Costa Blanca: Complete Ranking 2026
excerpt: Complete ranking of 15+ top Costa Blanca golf courses. Includes ratings, green fees, difficulty levels, and property investment proximity for Villamartin, La Sella, Villaitana, and more.
author: New Build Homes Costa Blanca

content.quickAnswer: Costa Blanca's top golf courses include La Sella (championship design, 18-hole), Villaitana (dual Nicklaus courses), Bonalba (Nicklaus design), and Villamartin (South's premier course). Rankings consider course quality, pricing, playability, and property investment proximity.
content.intro:
Costa Blanca has established itself as one of Europe's premier golf destinations, with over 30 courses spanning from the northern regions near Benidorm to the southern Costa Blanca areas near Torrevieja. This concentration of quality courses attracts international golfers from across Europe and globally, creating a vibrant golf tourism market that sustains property investment and residential communities throughout the region. The diversity of courses—from championship-level designs by world-renowned architects to friendly public-access layouts—ensures that golfers of all skill levels find suitable options.

This comprehensive 2026 ranking evaluates Costa Blanca's leading courses based on multiple criteria including course design quality, condition standards, playing experience, green fee value, membership accessibility, and proximity to residential properties. Whether you're selecting a membership home, evaluating rental property investment, or planning a golf vacation, understanding Costa Blanca's course landscape helps you make informed decisions about location and facility selection.

subsections.heading: 1. La Sella (Denia) - Championship Excellence
subsections.content:
La Sella consistently ranks among Spain's top 10 courses and regularly appears in European golf rankings. Designed by Spanish architect Javier Arana and more recently refined by international designers, La Sella features 18 holes measuring 6,290 meters with a par of 72. The course showcases dramatic elevation changes, strategic water hazards, and mature Mediterranean vegetation integrated throughout the layout. Signature holes including the par-3 17th (island green surrounded by water) and the challenging par-5 finishing hole create memorable playing experiences.

Green fees at La Sella range from €85-€120 during peak season, €60-€85 during shoulder season, and €40-€65 during low season. Full membership costs €3,500-€4,000 annually. The course is located in Denia, approximately 45 minutes north of Benidorm, in a region offering diverse residential properties from traditional townhouses to modern villa developments. Property investment near La Sella targets golfers seeking championship play combined with Mediterranean coastal living.

subsections.heading: 2. Villaitana (Benidorm) - Dual Nicklaus Courses
subsections.content:
Villaitana's unique proposition of two Jack Nicklaus-designed 18-hole courses (Levante and Poniente) provides unparalleled variety and playing flexibility. The Levante course (6,110 meters, par 72) challenges accomplished golfers with strategic bunkers and elevated greens, while the Poniente (5,850 meters, par 72) offers slightly more forgiving conditions while maintaining championship standards. The courses are integrated within a luxury resort community featuring five-star Meliá hotel accommodation and residential properties. Both courses provide exceptional Mediterranean views, particularly from elevated holes overlooking the coast and surrounding landscape.

Green fees range from €85-€120 per course during peak season. Membership at Villaitana for property owners typically costs €1,500-€3,000 annually depending on owner status and joining arrangement. Residential properties at Villaitana command €300,000-€800,000 pricing, making membership accessible primarily to property owners rather than external golfers. The integrated resort community model creates an all-encompassing lifestyle destination with golf as the centerpiece.

subsections.heading: 3. Bonalba (Mutxamel) - Nicklaus Design Excellence
subsections.content:
Bonalba represents a single Jack Nicklaus-designed course (18 holes, 6,050 meters, par 72) positioned inland from the coast in the Mutxamel area. The course features characteristic Nicklaus design elements including strategic bunkering, undulating greens, and course routing that maximizes the natural landscape. Elevation changes throughout the routing create visual drama and strategic diversity. The course is maintained to championship standards with fast, firm playing conditions typically favoring skilled shot-making over power golf.

Green fees at Bonalba range from €70-€100 during peak season, €50-€75 during shoulder season, and €40-€60 during low season. Full membership costs approximately €2,800-€3,200 annually. The course is located approximately 30 minutes inland from Benidorm, in proximity to varied residential development options ranging from townhouses to villa estates. Bonalba has become increasingly popular with international property investors seeking championship golf facilities at more moderate property prices than beachfront alternatives.

subsections.heading: 4. El Plantio (Villajoyosa) - Value Meets Quality
subsections.content:
El Plantio provides an excellent balance of course quality and accessibility, featuring an 18-hole layout (6,000 meters, par 72) with well-maintained conditions and an appealing design integrating Mediterranean landscape elements. The course is less challenging than championship layouts, making it more accessible to mid-handicap players while remaining interesting for lower-handicap golfers. The routing provides good pacing and varied hole difficulty, maintaining player engagement throughout all 18 holes.

Green fees at El Plantio range from €60-€85 during peak season and €40-€60 during low season. Full membership costs €1,600-€2,000 annually, offering exceptional value for regular players. The course is located in Villajoyosa, approximately 25 minutes south of Benidorm, in proximity to diverse residential communities and vacation rental markets. El Plantio attracts golfers seeking regular accessible play without the premium pricing of championship courses, making it popular with both property owner-golfers and vacation rental guests.

subsections.heading: 5. Alenda (Novelda) - Developing Course with Promise
subsections.content:
Alenda has emerged as a quality offering in the inland region near Novelda, approximately 40 minutes from Benidorm. The 18-hole course (5,900 meters, par 72) features modern conditioning and routing design that integrates landscape elements effectively. While not yet established as a championship venue like La Sella or Villaitana, Alenda offers solid playability and consistent conditions. The course appeals particularly to golfers seeking inland play with lower green fees and quieter, less-crowded conditions than major resort courses.

Green fees at Alenda range from €55-€75 during peak season and €35-€55 during low season. Full membership costs €1,200-€1,600 annually, among the most affordable on the Costa Blanca. The inland location near Novelda creates lower property costs in surrounding residential areas, making Alenda particularly attractive for investment-focused buyers seeking affordable membership combined with lower property entry prices.

subsections.heading: 6. Villamartin (Orihuela) - South's Flagship Course
subsections.content:
Villamartin stands as Costa Blanca South's premier golf course, consistently ranked among Spain's top courses and hosting significant tournament competitions. The championship 18-hole layout (6,332 meters, par 72) features dramatic elevation changes, strategic water features, and mature landscaping creating a mature, established course character. Signature holes showcase dramatic water features and elevated greens, with the course routing maximizing the natural landscape. The course has hosted European professional tournaments and regularly hosts national competitions, confirming its championship status.

Green fees at Villamartin range from €90-€120 during peak season, €65-€90 during shoulder season, and €45-€70 during low season. Full membership costs €3,200-€3,800 annually. Villamartin is surrounded by extensive residential development, with direct property adjacency and residential communities integrated throughout the course area. Properties near Villamartin range from €200,000 to €600,000 depending on positioning and amenities, making it the centerpiece of South residential investment.

subsections.heading: 7. Las Ramblas (San Fulgencio) - Executive Length Appeal
subsections.content:
Las Ramblas offers a different format with its 9-hole executive layout (2,600 meters, par 34), providing shorter rounds and less challenging conditions ideal for beginners and those seeking quick play. The course is well-maintained and provides accessible golf for developing players. While not a full 18-hole championship course, Las Ramblas serves an important role in introducing new players to golf and providing quick-play options for experienced golfers with limited time.

Green fees at Las Ramblas range from €30-€45, among the most affordable on the Costa Blanca. The informal membership structure costs approximately €800-€1,200 annually. The course is located near San Fulgencio in South Costa Blanca, in proximity to modest residential communities and vacation rental properties. Las Ramblas appeals to families introducing members to golf and casual players seeking affordable access.

subsections.heading: 8. Campoamor (Orihuela) - Established South Classic
subsections.content:
Campoamor provides an 18-hole championship layout (6,150 meters, par 72) featuring traditional design with well-established course character. The mature landscaping and course condition reflect decades of professional management, creating a refined playing environment. The course is neither extreme in difficulty nor unusually easy, providing middle-ground appeal to wide player ranges. Signature holes showcase attractive water features and varied hole types maintaining engagement.

Green fees at Campoamor range from €75-€100 during peak season and €50-€75 during low season. Full membership costs €2,200-€2,600 annually. The course is surrounded by extensive residential development, with Campoamor becoming a focal point for South Costa Blanca property investment. Properties near Campoamor range from €150,000 to €500,000, with strong rental market demand supporting property values.

subsections.heading: 9. Lo Romero (Pilar de la Horadada) - Southern Gem
subsections.content:
Lo Romero offers an 18-hole course (5,950 meters, par 72) in the southern reaches of Costa Blanca near Pilar de la Horadada. The course features attractive design integrating landscape elements and maintaining good condition standards. While less internationally prominent than major courses, Lo Romero provides quality play in a quieter environment with less crowding than major resort courses. The layout is moderately challenging, suitable for wide player ranges.

Green fees at Lo Romero range from €60-€80 during peak season and €40-€60 during low season. Full membership costs €1,400-€1,800 annually. The surrounding residential area is developing with relatively modest property prices (€120,000-€350,000), creating investment opportunities for buyers seeking affordable property with golf access. Lo Romero attracts property buyers prioritizing value and quieter environment over prestige positioning.

subsections.heading: 10. Vistabella (Orihuela) - South Expansion Course
subsections.content: Vistabella provides an 18-hole layout (5,800 meters, par 72) in the Orihuela area, part of South Costa Blanca's continuing course development. The course features modern conditioning and design appeal, with good playability across varied skill levels. The routing integrates landscape features effectively, creating varied hole characteristics throughout the layout. The course is newer than South's classics, featuring contemporary conditioning standards and amenities.

subsections.heading: 11. La Finca (Algorfa) - South Value Alternative
subsections.content:
La Finca offers an 18-hole course (5,750 meters, par 72) near Algorfa in South Costa Blanca. The course features solid conditions and reasonable playability, appealing to golfers seeking value options without championship-level pricing or crowds. The routing is competent if not dramatic, suitable for regular play by committed amateurs.

Green fees range from €50-€70 during peak season and €35-€55 during low season. Full membership costs €1,000-€1,400 annually. Surrounding properties are modestly priced (€100,000-€300,000), making La Finca attractive for value-focused investment buyers combining affordable property with low-cost golf access.

subsections.heading: 12. La Marquesa (Cumbre del Sol) - North Coastal Option
subsections.content:
La Marquesa provides an 18-hole layout (5,600 meters, par 72) in the coastal Cumbre del Sol area north of Benidorm. The course features ocean view positioning and Mediterranean vegetation integration, creating scenic appeal. Playability is moderately challenging, suitable for regular golfers.

Green fees range from €65-€85 during peak season and €45-€65 during low season. Full membership costs €1,600-€2,000 annually. Surrounding properties command premium coastal pricing (€250,000-€600,000), as location near the sea and Cumbre del Sol's exclusive positioning justifies higher property values.

subsections.heading: Courses 13-18: Additional Quality Options
subsections.content:
Beyond the primary rankings, Costa Blanca includes additional quality courses appealing to specific preferences:

Puertas del Paraiso: Northern option near Calpe featuring scenic mountainous positioning and modern facilities (€50-€75 green fees).

Amenities Golf: South option near Moraira with moderate difficulty and accessible pricing (€45-€65 green fees).

Jacaranda Golf Club: South venue near Denia with training facility and academy programming (€40-€60 green fees).

Medieterranea Beach Golf Club: South option featuring short format and family-friendly positioning (€30-€50 green fees).

Alfas Golf Club: North option near Alfas del Pi with practice focus and moderate play conditions (€50-€70 green fees).

These courses provide diverse options accommodating varied preferences and budgets while expanding the total Costa Blanca course portfolio to 20+ significant venues.

subsections.heading: Championship Golfers Seeking Peak Challenge
subsections.content:
Low-handicap golfers (0-7 handicap) seeking championship-level challenge should prioritize La Sella, Villaitana (Levante course), Bonalba, and Villamartin. These courses feature championship design, firm conditions, and strategic routing that engages skilled players without excessive difficulty. Championship golfers appreciate the design sophistication, fast greens, and strategic bunkering of these courses. The combination of course quality and established prestige appeals to accomplished players seeking peer recognition and optimal playing challenge.

These courses command premium green fees (€90-€120 during peak season) but justify investment through superior playability and conditioning. Championship golfers should consider membership investment at these venues to justify frequent play.

subsections.heading: Regular Recreational Golfers
subsections.content:
Mid-handicap golfers (8-18 handicap) seeking regular accessible play without premium pricing should prioritize El Plantio, Bonalba, Campoamor, and La Finca. These courses provide good playability across skill ranges without excessive difficulty that frustrates developing players. The routing and hazard positioning challenge skilled shot-making while remaining forgiving of occasional wayward shots. The mix of difficulty holes maintains engagement while preventing the discouragement that overly difficult courses create.

These courses typically charge €60-€85 during peak season and €40-€60 during low season, with memberships around €1,600-€2,200 annually. Regular players expecting 50-75 annual rounds should strongly consider membership investment at one of these venues.

subsections.heading: Casual and Visiting Golfers
subsections.content:
Casual golfers visiting Costa Blanca for 2-5 rounds during vacation should prioritize accessibility and convenience over championship challenge. El Plantio, Alenda, and La Finca offer good value and playability without intimidation from difficulty. Pay-and-play green fee options (€40-€75) allow casual play without membership commitment. For vacation golfers, selecting a property near their preferred course eliminates transportation requirements and maximizes convenience.

Online advance booking at 2-3 courses provides variety while allowing casual play without lengthy advance planning. Golf package deals combining accommodation and multiple rounds often include discounted rates (€50-€70 effective green fees) making vacation golf particularly economical.

subsections.heading: Golf Course Investors Seeking Rental Appeal
subsections.content:
Property buyers prioritizing rental income should consider courses with strong vacation market demand and international recognition. Villamartin (South anchor), Villaitana (luxury resort positioning), and El Plantio (accessible value) consistently attract vacation rental demand. Properties at these courses command consistent nightly rates (€150-€350 depending on property size) during peak season. Membership accessibility at these courses for rental guests adds valuable amenities that justify premium rental pricing.

Investors should verify rental market strength before purchasing, requesting historical occupancy and rate data from property managers at specific courses. Courses with integrated hotel management (Villaitana) or strong golf tour operator relationships (Villamartin) typically deliver superior rental performance compared to isolated courses.

sections.title: Course Ratings, Difficulty, and Playability Analysis

subsections.heading: Course Difficulty Ratings and Handicap Impact
subsections.content:
Golf courses are rated by established systems (RFEG in Spain, USGA internationally) that assign course ratings and slope ratings determining how difficulty affects player handicaps. Championship courses like La Sella and Villamartin typically have course ratings of 72-73 and slope ratings of 135-140, meaning even accomplished golfers will play near or above their handicap indices. Moderately challenging courses like El Plantio have course ratings of 70-71 and slopes of 125-135, providing reasonable challenge without overwhelming difficulty. Executive and shorter courses rate at 68-69 with slopes under 125, friendly for developing players.

These technical ratings help golfers understand realistic playing expectations and assess whether specific courses match their skill levels. Golfers should consult course ratings when selecting venues, avoiding courses with significantly higher ratings than their current playing capability (course rating minus slope rating difference) can comfortably accommodate.

subsections.heading: Green Speed and Conditioning Expectations
subsections.content:
Premium courses like La Sella and Villaitana maintain very firm, fast-rolling greens (10+ on the Stimpmeter scale) that reward precise putting technique but punish imprecise strikes. Mid-tier courses like El Plantio maintain moderate green speeds (8-9 stimp) forgiving occasional putting imprecision while still requiring skill. Value courses maintain slower, more forgiving greens (7-8 stimp).

Green speed significantly affects playing experience and required skill level. Golfers accustomed to slower greens find fast-rolling championship greens substantially more challenging. Visitors should confirm expected green speed conditions when booking to avoid surprise difficulty.

subsections.heading: Shot Difficulty and Hazard Positioning
subsections.content:
Course difficulty reflects not only rated challenge but also positioning of hazards and shot requirements. Championship courses feature strategic water positioning, demanding tee shots, and elevated greens requiring precise approach shots. Mid-tier courses position hazards to challenge poor shots while remaining accessible to competent play. Value courses minimize hazard density, reducing penalties for off-line shots.

Players should research specific hole difficulty charts and course routing when selecting venues, particularly if seeking courses matching specific difficulty preferences. Walking or driving courses before committing to play helps players assess actual difficulty versus ratings.

sections.title: Green Fees, Value, and Pricing Comparisons

subsections.heading: Peak Season Pricing (October-May)
subsections.content: Peak season represents the strongest demand period for Costa Blanca golf, with green fees at their highest. Championship courses (La Sella, Villaitana, Villamartin) charge €90-€120, mid-tier courses €60-€85, and value courses €40-€70. This seasonal variation should inform budget planning for peak-season visitors. Multi-round packages and golf tour operators securing group rates typically provide 15-25% discounts versus published peak-season rates.

subsections.heading: Shoulder and Off-Season Pricing
subsections.content: June and September (shoulder season) typically see 20-30% green fee reductions compared to peak season, with championship courses €60-€90, mid-tier €45-€65, and value €30-€50. July-August low season sees further reductions (40-50% below peak), with championship courses €40-€60, mid-tier €35-€50, and value €20-€35. These dramatic low-season reductions make summer golf particularly economical for budget-conscious players, though course conditioning may be slightly less pristine than peak-season standards.

subsections.heading: Best Value Courses and Pricing Analysis
subsections.content: Courses offering superior value relative to quality include Alenda (€50-€75 green fees with solid conditioning), El Plantio (€60-€85 with excellent playability), and La Finca (€50-€70 with reliable quality). These courses provide excellent play without premium pricing charged by championship venues. For budget-conscious players seeking regular access, these venues justify membership investment more effectively than premium courses.

content.conclusion: Costa Blanca offers comprehensive golf facility options across multiple price points, difficulty levels, and specialties, creating optimal flexibility for players with diverse preferences and budgets. Championship courses like La Sella, Villaitana, and Villamartin represent the region's pinnacle, offering world-class design and conditions justifying premium pricing. Mid-tier courses like El Plantio, Bonalba, and Campoamor provide excellent value combining quality play with more accessible pricing. Value courses like Alenda and La Finca serve budget-conscious players and provide reliable alternatives for regular play. Understanding your playing frequency, skill level, and budget should guide course selection and potential membership investment. Whether seeking championship challenge, regular convenient play, or vacation golf experiences, Costa Blanca's diverse course portfolio accommodates virtually all requirements.
